question_text: Why would we want to integrate Enterprise Systems? Select the best answer.
Which are characteristics of on-premise infrastructure? (Select the option that lists only correct characteristics)

options.A: Pay As You Go, Controlled by 3rd Party, Operational Expense
options.B: Controlled By Your Organization, Capital Expense, Pay Upfront
options.C: Controlled by 3rd Party, Operational Expense, Scalable on demand
options.D: Pay As You Go, No maintenance required, Instant deployment

question_text: In which scenario would using Cloud Based Software (SaaS) likely be most advantageous?

options.A: Your IT department has specific security requirements
options.B: You are storing sensitive data (trade secrets)
options.C: You are a small company with limited IT resources

question_text: Which of the following would be considered Enterprise Systems?

options.A: Personal productivity script and individual Excel spreadsheet
options.B: Systems used organization-wide like CRM, HR system, and time tracking

question_text: What capability does JIRA provide?
Which statement about production installation methods for Confluence or JIRA is correct?

options.B: Only Docker Container can be used
options.C: Multiple methods are available including various OS installers and containers
options.D: Only Archive Files can be used

question_text: What database options are supported for production JIRA or Confluence installations?

options.B: Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Microsoft SQL Server

question_text: Select the best definition of a Functional Requirement.

options.A: Defines a function in a procedural program
options.B: Defines function points in the software
options.C: Defines how the software source code functions
options.D: Defines a function of a system or its component

question_text: Select the best definition of a Non-Functional Requirement.

options.A: Defines the design of the software source code
options.B: Defines constraints on the design or implementation of a system
options.C: Defines all code defined outside of functions

question_text: Functional requirements may involve calculations, technical details, data manipulation and processing, and other specific functionality that define what a system is supposed to accomplish.
Which of the following is an example of a Functional Requirement?

options.A: System must be restored from backups within 8 hours
options.B: System must fail over to backup within 20 minutes
options.C: System bills the user's credit card after order confirmation
options.D: All personally identifiable data must be encrypted

question_text: For Functional Requirements, a function is described as a specification of behavior between outputs and inputs
Non-Functional Requirements are also referred to as 'ilities'.
Which of the following would be considered a Non-Functional Requirement?

options.A: System sends email notification when order completes
options.B: System allows users to enter and track orders
options.C: System must work on Chrome, Firefox and Safari browsers

question_text: Non-Functional Requirements are also referred to as System Quality Attributes.
Which of the following are ALL categories of Non-Functional Requirements?

options.D: Security, Scalability, Availability, Usability, Testability, and Maintainability

question_text: Non-Functional Requirements are also referred to as Architecturally Significant Requirements.
The definition of a Jenkins pipeline is written in a text file. What is this text file called?
What are advantages of defining a Jenkins pipeline in a file in source control?

options.A: Provides single source of truth, enables code review, and creates audit trail
options.B: Eliminates all need for human intervention

question_text: A Pipeline is a user-defined model of a CI/CD pipeline. A Pipeline's code defines your entire build process, which typically includes stages for building, testing and delivering.
In Jenkins declarative pipeline syntax, the pipeline is organized into:
A stage block defines a conceptually distinct subset of tasks performed by the Pipeline (e.g. 'Build', 'Test' and 'Deploy' stages)
Which statement about the agent section of a declarative pipeline is correct?

options.A: It is optional and only validates outputs
options.C: It is required and specifies where the pipeline will execute
options.D: It is only used for debugging

question_text: A Jenkins pipeline should be triggered by which of the following? Choose the best answer.
It is generally considered best practice to define and maintain the Jenkins pipeline definition directly within a Jenkins build job
A Step in a Jenkins pipeline is a single task. Fundamentally, a step tells Jenkins what to do at a particular point in time (e.g., executing sh 'make')
Jenkins pipelines support parallel execution and definition of shared libraries for reuse.
The Jenkins web server and 'brains' of the system. Select the best answer.
What manages the execution of tasks on a node?
What runs the stages in a pipeline?
An Agent is a Java application that connects to the Controller and is meant to be highly reliable. Because it is Java based it can run on any platform that supports Java.
An Agent and a Node are effectively the same thing
What are two key reasons for using Jenkins Agent Nodes separate from the Controller?

options.A: Cross Browser Support and Simpler Setup

question_text: The following is a practical definition of DevOps: DevOps is the practice of operations and development engineers participating together in the entire service lifecycle, from design through the development process to production support.
Identify the three primary practice areas of DevOps.

options.A: On-Call Developers, DevOps Practices, Agile Practices
options.B: Continuous Delivery, Site Reliability Engineering, Infrastructure Automation

question_text: Infrastructure Automation refers to creating your systems, OS configs, and app deployments as code. This code is stored in a source code management system.
Continuous Delivery means having developers and operations engineers manually build, test, deploy your apps daily.
Site Reliability Engineering includes operating your systems; monitoring and orchestration. It also includes designing for operability in the first place.
What should go in your project's single source code repository?

options.B: Code, database schemas, install scripts, and test scripts

question_text: A continuous integration server is where (select the best answer):

options.A: The build is run automatically every time the code changes
options.B: The build is run manually on a daily basis
options.C: The build is run automatically every 5 minutes
options.D: The build is run automatically on a daily basis

question_text: Frequently committing to the mainline in the source code repository helps developers quickly find out if there's a conflict between two developers (in terms of their code changes).
When a build breaks, 'nobody has a higher priority task than fixing the build' (Kent Beck). This means that all developers on the team should immediately focus on fixing the build.
Which of the following describes important characteristics of a good Continuous Integration pipeline?

options.A: Manual processes and human approval at each step
options.B: Fast builds, automated testing, runs on every checkin, and visibility

question_text: A stakeholder is anyone that has an interest (or concern) in the realization of the system or tools you are evaluating and planning to bring into the enterprise.
From the following list, who would most likely be considered stakeholders for an Enterprise Development Environment?

options.C: PM, IT Operations Team, Test Team, and Development Team

question_text: A Jenkins pipeline shared library consists of which three items (one of which is optional)?

options.A: Version, Name, and Source Code Retrieval Method

question_text: Shared Libraries in Jenkins pipelines let us share parts of Pipelines between various projects to reduce redundancies and keep code 'DRY'.
Shared libraries for Jenkins pipelines can include code written in which language?
Given a shared library 'my-shared-library' with evenOrOdd.groovy in the vars folder, how would you import and call the code?
A Shared Library Repository is organized into specific folders: /src for Groovy source files, /vars for script files exposed as variables, and /resources for non-Groovy files.
Which tools and resources help with development of Jenkins Pipelines?

options.B: Replay Pipeline Runs, IDE Plugins, Blue Ocean Editor, and Command-Line Linter

question_text: In Lab 5 you created a Jenkinsfile that defined a pipeline for a Python program. What were the stages in that pipeline?
Why would we want to use shared libraries for Jenkins pipelines?
Global Pipeline Libraries, defined in the Jenkins Configuration, are only available to specific pipeline jobs in the Jenkins server.
Static code analysis is best described as...
What are three key benefits of static code analysis?

options.B: Ensures compliance with standards, finds dormant errors, and reduces manual review effort

question_text: Static and dynamic code analysis, considered together, are sometimes referred to as which of the following?

A Quality Gate is a set of conditions that tells you whether or not your project is ready for release. You should not set and enforce a quality gate until all code, new and old, will meet the standard.
What are the types of issues that SonarQube can track in your code?
SonarQube's definition of Technical Debt is: The estimated time required to fix all maintainability issues and code smells identified in the code
In SonarQube, a snapshot is a set of measures and issues on a given project at a given time. It is generated for each analysis.
In SonarQube, what best describes a scanner?

options.C: Web interface that is used to browse snapshot data
options.D: A client application that analyzes the source code to compute snapshots

question_text: What are the four main components of the SonarQube platform?

options.B: Server, Scanners for Code Analysis, Plugins, and Database

question_text: Where should code analysis first be performed using the SonarQube platform? Choose the best answer.
